title: 108_hr1911
content: The Department of Defense-Department of Veterans Affairs Joint Executive Committee is established. The Department of Veterans Affairs-Department of Defense Joint Executive Committee is established as an interagency committee composed of designated officials from both departments. The Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs establish a Joint Executive Committee, with designated officials determining its size, structure, and operational guidelines. The Committee provides strategic direction for joint coordination and sharing. The Joint Executive Committee oversees coordination and sharing efforts between the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs. It reviews existing policies and identifies changes to promote mutually beneficial coordination and resource sharing. The Committee submits an annual report with recommendations to the Secretaries and Congress. The Joint Executive Committee aims to enhance the delivery of benefits and services to veterans and their families through improved coordination between the Department of Veterans Affairs and the Department of Defense. It evaluates opportunities for collaboration without compromising services or care quality, and reviews acquisition plans for resources to assess their impact on future opportunities. The Joint Executive Committee evaluates the impact of acquisition plans on coordination and sharing of resources between the Department of Veterans Affairs and the Department of Defense. The Department of Veterans Affairs-Department of Defense Joint Executive Committee is amended in various subsections to reflect changes in resource coordination and acquisition plans evaluation. The Department of Veterans Affairs-Department of Defense Joint Executive Committee is amended to include further opportunities for sharing health-care resources and any recommendations made during the fiscal year. Technical amendments are also made to specify the effective date of the changes. The Department of Veterans Affairs-Department of Defense Joint Executive Committee is amended to include more health-care resource sharing opportunities and recommendations. The amendments made by subsections (b) and (c) will take effect on October 1, 2003, following the enactment of the Bob Stump National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2003. If this Act is enacted on or after October 1, 2003, the amendments made by this section will take effect on the date of enactment. The House of Representatives passed the bill on May 21, 2003.
